records.location_details: Demonstration inside Kos RIC blocking the main entrance. One migrant died due to diabetes problems.
records.geocodable_query: Kos Reception and Identification Centre, Kos, Greece
records.uncertainty_note: Provided coordinates are 0.0000000000, which are invalid. Location inferred from text.
records.context_note: Some 200-300 migrants started a loud but non-violent demonstration inside Kos RIC, blocking the main entrance. An anti-riot unit was present, and the demonstration ended without consequences. Separately, one migrant (IRQ) died due to diabetes problems in Kos RIC.
records.evidence_quote: On 30 May at 11:00, some 200-300 migrants started a demonstration inside Kos RIC blocking the main entrance. The demonstration was loud, but not violent. ... one migrant (IRQ) died due to diabetes problems.

records.location_details: One migrant apprehended at Mykali coastal area of Samos island, claimed another was missing. A dead body was later found at Mertziki SE of Samos island, identified as the missing person.
records.where_clear: Coastal area of Mykali and Mertziki, Samos Island
records.location_text_raw: Mykali'' coastal area of Samos island, Mertziki'' SE of Samos island
records.uncertainty_note: Specific coordinates are redacted. Location inferred from text.
records.context_note: A migrant apprehended at Mykali coastal area of Samos island reported another migrant missing after they swam from Turkey. A SAR operation was launched with negative results. Later, a dead body was found at Mertziki SE of Samos island, identified by the apprehended migrant as his friend. Necropsy requested, investigation ongoing.
records.evidence_quote: 1 MISSING PERSON OFF SAMOS ISLAND ... 01 rescued migrant 01 casualty (01 male) ... At 12/05/2019 a dead body was found by HCG and HP personnel at coastal area ''Mertziki'' SE of Samos island.

records.location_details: Car crash at the crossroad of Ethelonton Polemiston Kos street and Antigonis street on Kos Island.
records.where_clear: Crossroad of Ethelonton Polemiston and Antigonis streets, Kos Island
records.location_text_raw: crossroad of Ethelonton Polemiston Kos street and Antigonis street at Kos Island
records.geocodable_query: Ethelonton Polemiston street and Antigonis street, Kos, Greece
records.uncertainty_note: Provided coordinates are 0.0000000000, which are invalid. Location inferred from text.
records.context_note: A car crash occurred at an intersection on Kos Island between a rental patrol car and another vehicle that failed to stop at a sign. Both cars sustained significant damage. Local traffic police handled the incident. Alcohol tests for both drivers were negative. No seriously injured persons, only shock and small scratches were reported.
records.evidence_quote: About 3:10 there were a car crash at crossroad of Ethelonton Polemiston Kos street and Antigonis street ... No seriously injured persons, only shock and small scratches.

records.location_details: A female dead body of African origin was discovered by a fishing boat in the sea area of Karlovasi at Samos Island. Later, 51 migrants were detected at Karlovasi port, reporting one person missing.
records.where_clear: Sea area and coastal area of Karlovasi, Samos Island
records.location_text_raw: sea area of Karlovasi at Samos Island, coastal area of Karlovasi port
records.uncertainty_note: Provided coordinates are 0.0000000000, which are invalid. Location inferred from text.
records.context_note: A female dead body of African origin was found in the sea near Karlovasi, Samos Island. On the same day, 51 migrants were detected at Karlovasi port, and they stated that one person was missing.
records.evidence_quote: Corpse found in the sea at Samos Island ... a female dead body, African origin, was discovered by a fishing boat in the sea area of Karlovasi at Samos Island. ... according to migrants statements 1 person was missing.

records.location_details: A dead body was found on the rocks, adjacent to the sea, in the area of Vrontados (North of Chios town) on Chios Island.
records.where_clear: Vrontados area, north of Chios town, Chios Island
records.location_text_raw: area of Vrontados (North of Chios town) a dead body was found on the rocks, adjacent to the sea.
records.uncertainty_note: Provided coordinates are 0.0000000000, which are invalid. Location inferred from text.
records.context_note: A dead body was found on the rocks near the sea in Vrontados, Chios Island. The body could be connected to an incident on 28.03.2019 where 36 migrants landed on Chios and reported 2 people missing, for whom a SAR operation was launched without positive results. Identification of the corpse is ongoing.
records.evidence_quote: Corpse found in Chios Island ... in the area of Vrontados (North of Chios town) a dead body was found on the rocks, adjacent to the sea.

records.location_details: Three dead men bodies were found on two beaches in Rhodes Island: Afantou beach (eastern side) and Faliraki beach.
records.where_clear: Afantou beach and Faliraki beach, Rhodes Island
records.location_text_raw: Afantou beach (eastern side of the island), Faliraki beach
records.geocodable_query: Afantou beach, Rhodes, Greece; Faliraki beach, Rhodes, Greece
records.uncertainty_note: Provided coordinates are 0.0000000000, which are invalid. Location inferred from text.
records.context_note: On April 6th and 7th, three fully clothed dead men bodies were found on Afantou beach and Faliraki beach on Rhodes Island. Autopsies are to be performed to determine the cause of death and if they were migrants from Turkey.
records.evidence_quote: 3 dead bodies found in Rhodes Island ... on 6th and 7th April, 3 dead men bodies fully clothes were found on two Rhodes's beaches. The first body was found on Saturday afternoon at Afantou beach ... A second body was found on Sunday morning at the same beach and the third corpse was discovered on Sunday at Faliraki beach.

records.location_details: Two dead bodies found on Lesvos Island: one on Vatera beach and another in a rocky area of the coast at Agios Theodoros.
records.where_clear: Vatera beach and Agios Theodoros coastal area, Lesvos Island
records.location_text_raw: beach Vatera, Lesvos Island, rocky are of the coast Agios Theodoros, Lesvos Island
records.geocodable_query: Vatera beach, Lesvos, Greece; Agios Theodoros, Lesvos, Greece
records.uncertainty_note: Provided coordinates are 0.0000000000, which are invalid. Location inferred from text.
records.context_note: On March 10, 2019, remains of an unidentified girl were found on Vatera beach, Lesvos Island. On the same day, another female body was found in a rocky area of the coast at Agios Theodoros, Lesvos Island. Autopsies were ordered for both cases, and preliminary assessments provided details on the bodies. Investigation is ongoing.
records.evidence_quote: 2 dead bodies found in Lesvos, one of them headless ... 1st incident - 10/03/2019 morning hours remains of an unidentified girl were found on the beach Vatera, Lesvos Island. 2nd incident - 10/03/2019 midday another body of female was spotted in a rocky are of the coast Agios Theodoros, Lesvos Island.

records.location_details: Boat in distress in the sea area East of Samos island, inside Turkish SRR.
records.where_clear: Sea area east of Samos Island, within Turkish Search and Rescue Region (SRR)
records.location_text_raw: sea area East of Samos island inside Turkish SRR
records.country_or_area: Aegean Sea (Turkish SRR), near Samos Island
records.geocodable_query: East of Samos Island, Aegean Sea
records.context_note: JRCC Piraeus received a call about a boat in distress east of Samos island within Turkish SRR. A SAR operation was launched. 8 persons were rescued, one found semiconscious. Another 3 persons were rescued, one also semiconscious. A dead body was recovered. Two deaths were confirmed at the hospital. Rescued persons stated no other missing persons.
records.evidence_quote: 09 rescued migrants and 03 casualties ... a boat with POB in distress at the sea area East of Samos island inside Turkish SRR. ... the death of two people was confirmed. According to the rescued people's statements there are no any other missing person.

records.location_details: An individual was admitted to Samos Hospital with back pain and suspected kidney disease.
records.uncertainty_note: Coordinates not provided. Location inferred from text.
records.context_note: An individual was admitted to Samos Hospital with back pain, suspected kidney disease. Blood, urine, and further examinations were ongoing. Examination confirmed inflammation, and after antibiotic treatment, the officer felt fine without pain.
records.evidence_quote: Injured persons: 1 ... Text Removed - Justification 4 was admitted to Samos Hospital, with the symptom of pain in the back; There is suspicious for kidney disease
